2020-10-25T15:05:00Z: We'll see you next weekend for the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix - at Imola. Thanks for joining us, Portu-guys and Portu-gals!
2020-10-25T15:04:33Z: And here's the report, from the desk of A. Kalinauckas. F1 Portuguese GP: Hamilton beats Bottas to secure all-time F1 win recordLewis Hamilton triumphed in Formula 1's 2020 Portuguese Grand Prix ahead of Valtteri Bottas, with Mercedes recovering from slow, slippery opening laps, as Carlos Sainz Jr led the early stages
2020-10-25T14:51:09Z: 11. Raikkonen, 12. Albon, 13. Norris, 14. Russell, 15. Giovinazzi, 16. Magnussen, 17. Grosjean, 18. Latifi, 19. Kvyat, DNF. Stroll
2020-10-25T14:50:07Z: Full order: 1. Hamilton, 2. Bottas, 3. Verstappen, 4. Leclerc, 5. Gasly, 6. Sainz, 7. Perez, 8. Ocon, 9. Ricciardo, 10. Vettel
2020-10-25T14:47:38Z: Bono himself will join Hamilton on the podium for this one - that's probably quite fitting.
2020-10-25T14:45:45Z: Verstappen is third, with Leclerc fourth and Gasly fifth. Sainz took sixth from Perez late on, Ocon held on from Ricciardo, and Vettel completes the top 10.
2020-10-25T14:44:53Z: Hamilton has the most wins of anyone in F1 with that, with a 25.5s advantage of Bottas.
2020-10-25T14:43:58Z: But it's Lewis Hamilton who wins his 92nd F1 grand prix!
2020-10-25T14:43:44Z: Indeed, Sainz powers past Perez for P6. The stewards are looking at the Gasly/Perez moment too
2020-10-25T14:42:26Z: And Gasly goes the long way round to snatch fifth from Perez. Sainz is now right on the Racing Point's tail.
2020-10-25T14:41:52Z: That's some robust defending from Perez, doing everything he could to keep Gasly behind. A late move, but Gasly has another tilt...
2020-10-25T14:40:52Z: Hamilton logs a 1m18.750s at the end of lap 63. Verstappen enquires about the fastest lap in the meantime.
2020-10-25T14:38:40Z: More light rain in the pitlane. I think we'd prefer a deluge.
2020-10-25T14:37:58Z: Gasly's eaten into Perez's fifth place, so this isn't a given for the Racing Point driver. Sainz is lurking behind them too.
2020-10-25T14:36:24Z: Race leader Hamilton has some cramp. Regardless, he's extended his lead over Bottas on the previous lap, setting a 1m19.484s in the process.
2020-10-25T14:36:01Z: Norris, who had his race hampered by a clash with Stroll and a slow puncture, gets up to 13th place by overtaking Russell. That is probably as good as it will get with Albon ahead of him 14 seconds up the road with six laps to go.
2020-10-25T14:30:22Z: Vettel gets ahead of Raikkonen to take 10th place and is in position for his first point since the Mugello race.
2020-10-25T14:29:56Z: Perez is now up to fifth as a result, still four seconds clear of Gasly.
2020-10-25T14:29:09Z: Kvyat might have avoided a five-second time penalty for blue flags but he gets one for exceeding track limits. The Russian is currently P15 and it hasn't been a great race for him, especially with team-mate Gasly in sixth.
2020-10-25T14:28:00Z: Oh, there we are - Ocon finally comes in for fresh boots. He rejoins on softs just ahead of team-mate Ricciardo.
2020-10-25T14:27:50Z: The Portuguese GP has its first retirement as Stroll pulls in to the Racing Point garage. He was last and well down in the running so had little to gain from making it to the finish.
2020-10-25T14:26:30Z: Vettel, who hasn't really featured in this race, has somehow found himself behind Raikkonen for what feels like the 10th race running. The Finn currently holds the final points position so the fight is on.
2020-10-25T14:26:29Z: Ocon is...still yet to stop. If he was allowed to no-stop here, I think he probably would.
2020-10-25T14:22:56Z: Hamilton beats Bottas' 1m19.922 by...0.001s. Literal thousandths in this battle for fastest lap point.
2020-10-25T14:21:37Z: Kvyat avoids the same fate he suffered in Barcelona as the race stewards decide to take no further action on his blue flag investigation.
2020-10-25T14:21:32Z: Albon's pitstop of 1.8s is the fastest thing he's done all afternoon. Thought we saw him passing someone too, but it just turned out it was Verstappen lapping someone.
2020-10-25T14:19:00Z: A 1m19.922 for Bottas on that lap, stealing the fastest lap from Hamilton on that lap by 0.001s. He's fired up now.
2020-10-25T14:18:44Z: Kvyat has been put under investigation for ignoring blue flags. That's a rule he fell foul of at the Spanish GP earlier this season as part of a crackdown for this year so he could be in trouble.
2020-10-25T14:18:19Z: Soft tyres for Perez too, which should last these final 19 laps.
2020-10-25T14:17:44Z: Perez comes in to pit for the second time this race, having built enough of a gap over Gasly, Ricciardo et al. Great recovery from the Mexican, who rejoins sixth.
2020-10-25T14:16:56Z: Gasly has been stalking Ricciardo for a few laps and finally makes his move on lap 46 diving down the inside under braking for the first corner. The move sticks to see the AlphaTauri driver move up to seventh place.
2020-10-25T14:15:19Z: Ocon must be a great carer because he is nursing his tyres really well. Still yet to pit, he starts lap 45 with his medium rubber still in good shape which means he is still in sixth place.
2020-10-25T14:14:59Z: Esteban Ocon, still sixth, is yet to pit. He'll come out in this Ricciardo/Gasly battle if he does in the next couple of laps.
2020-10-25T14:12:58Z: Bottas emerged in lower-midfield traffic, and is currently trying to put a lap on Kvyat, having lost ground to the Russian after locking up at turn 5. Difficult to get the tyres up to temperature here.
2020-10-25T14:12:13Z: Grosjean has exceeded track limits too many times and is the next driver to pick up a five-second time penalty. He gets it just as Bottas, having pitted, becomes an unexpected chicane that he can't really get by for fear of the blue flags.
2020-10-25T14:09:14Z: Hamilton pits for the hard tyre now, coming out in second having built such a commanding gap over the non-Mercedes cars.
2020-10-25T14:08:09Z: Out of the midfield runners only Ocon, in sixth, is yet to pit. Elsewhere Kvyat becomes the latest driver to be shown the black and white flag for track limit infringements.
2020-10-25T14:06:46Z: Bottas gets pinged for track limits, so he's going to have to be careful from here-on in.
2020-10-25T14:05:42Z: Russell finally pits on lap 37 having climbed up to seventh place and returns to the action in 14th for Williams.
2020-10-25T14:04:07Z: Stroll comes in for his second pitstop and duly serves his five plus five time penalties to drop to last place and 36 seconds behind Magnussen ahead of him. Ouch.
2020-10-25T14:02:37Z: In the meantime, we had a phenomenal battle for fifth between Perez and Ocon. Perez was forced to the outside line into turn 5, but kept it planted and managed to hold the line for position.
2020-10-25T14:02:13Z: Inspired by Raikkonen and Sainz, Ocon and Perez produce stunning racing on lap 35. Ocon defends on the inside at the Turn 5 hairpin but that forces him to the outside when they get to Turns 7 and 8 and Perez dives ahead to take fifth place.
2020-10-25T14:01:39Z: Leclerc pits, as Verstappen begins to find time in the mediums. Hard tyres for the Ferrari driver, who rejoins in fourth.
2020-10-25T14:00:08Z: Bottas is told to cool the car, with a warning on his dash. He's already 8s behind Hamilton now too.
2020-10-25T14:00:02Z: Sainz and Raikkonen produce a battle royale on lap 33 for 10th place as Sainz draws alongside on two occasions, Turns 1 and 6, but supreme defending from the Finn sees him keep the place. It isn't for long as DRS assistance gives Sainz the place at the start of the next lap.
2020-10-25T13:56:55Z: On new mediums, Verstappen's taking baby steps into Leclerc's advantage, but not by a lot.
2020-10-25T13:56:35Z: Stroll is having a bad afternoon so far, as he gets another five-second time penalty - this time for exceeding track limits too many times already in this race. We're not even at halfway distance.
2020-10-25T13:55:22Z: Grosjean is the next driver to be shown the black and white flag for exceeding track limits too many times. The Haas driver is currently in P17 tucked up behind Giovinazzi.
2020-10-25T13:54:20Z: Gasly also comes in to pit from fourth, returning ahead of Ricciardo.
2020-10-25T13:54:10Z: There are drops of rain on a number of TV cameras around the lap but it looks like the kind of precipitation that won't require intermediate or wet tyres. Dry rain, if you like. But we don't have a graphic for that.
2020-10-25T13:51:45Z: Sainz pits from fifth, just as Verstappen was due to get by him. He rejoins on mediums behind Raikkonen and ahead of Albon.
2020-10-25T13:50:02Z: Perez has duly got ahead of Russell to take ninth place without too much trouble. The Mexican is the fastest driver on the track currently.
2020-10-25T13:49:28Z: A 1m20.775s for Hamilton, who extends the lead to four seconds.
2020-10-25T13:47:08Z: Stroll has been given a five-second time penalty for causing the collision with Norris. A fair judgement on that clash.
2020-10-25T13:47:06Z: Verstappen comes out just ahead of Ocon, so Gasly and Sainz have got through. Medium tyres for Max.
2020-10-25T13:46:09Z: At the start of lap 23 Perez moves up another place as he overtakes Giovinazzi for 10th place. Next up is Russell in the Williams and given the speculation over that race seat between the two this could be tasty.
2020-10-25T13:45:51Z: Gap between Hamilton and Bottas is now up to 3s, as Verstappen pits from third place.
2020-10-25T13:44:46Z: Perez is continuing his charge back through the pack after his lap one clash with Verstappen, as he darts ahead of Gasly on the main straight to take 11th place. With everyone ahead yet to pit he still has a shot at points.
2020-10-25T13:43:08Z: Gasly did what Stroll couldn't and clears a McLaren. Sainz now drops to sixth.
2020-10-25T13:42:14Z: That Norris vs Stroll clash has given Ocon a free promotion to seventh place, with Vettel up to eighth place. Welcome gifts for those two given their recent form.
2020-10-25T13:41:54Z: Bottas tried the pocketsand method of defense, but Hamilton was too quick and was able to rub any off-line dirt out of his eyes.
2020-10-25T13:41:01Z: Hamilton clears Bottas to take the lead! The British driver is a lot quicker, gets the momentum in the final corner and gets clear with DRS.
2020-10-25T13:40:21Z: Both Norris and Stroll pit after that contact and both have been placed under investigation for the incident.
2020-10-25T13:39:40Z: Not a good moment for Stroll. The Racing Point driver had been hounding Norris for seventh place but a half-move around the outside at Turn 1 sees him clip the McLaren driver and get into a spin. Stroll gets going again but is down in 16th.
2020-10-25T13:38:17Z: Gasly's all over Sainz now, who's trying to keep the French driver at bay.
2020-10-25T13:35:42Z: Hamilton sets the fastest lap, a 1m21.366s. We see you.
2020-10-25T13:34:24Z: Ricciardo pits as expected to get rid of his softs for new mediums and returns in 19th place. Sensible call by Renault as he was also holding up team-mate Ocon.
2020-10-25T13:32:58Z: Ricciardo is now the sitting duck on the straight as he losses places to both Gasly and Stroll on consecutive laps. The running order is still yet to settle down which is keeping everyone pretty busy as thoughts start to shift to the pitstops.
2020-10-25T13:32:37Z: At the front, Bottas still leads with a healthy 2.3s gap over Hamilton. He's also got the fastest lap so far.
2020-10-25T13:30:58Z: Raikkonen duly pits at the end of lap 11 to trade his softs for a new set of mediums. That puts him down to 20th and last for the time being.
2020-10-25T13:30:28Z: Leclerc is now back into fourth, passing Sainz with DRS.
2020-10-25T13:30:00Z: Raikkonen won't be enjoying the lack of speed on the straights his Alfa Romeo possesses as he gets overtaken again on the main straight. Gasly is the benefactor this time to take eighth place.
2020-10-25T13:29:21Z: Leclerc's now right on Sainz's tail. They'll be team-mates next year, and Sainz might now wish he was in that Ferrari as it seems to have a splash of pace.
2020-10-25T13:28:34Z: Stroll has been shown the black and white flag on lap 10. He's been crossing those track limits quite often and the rules are if any driver does it more than three times they get shown said flag. If he continues that trend he'll be in trouble with the race stewards.
2020-10-25T13:26:49Z: Leclerc now steams past Norris, calm as you like with the DRS. Fifth place is his reward for that, and Norris doesn't have the pace to stay with him.
2020-10-25T13:26:13Z: Normality is returning to the F1 pecking order, as a lap later Raikkonen loses seventh place to Ricciardo using the DRS to power around the outside of the Alfa Romeo in the charge down to Turn 1.
2020-10-25T13:24:55Z: And indeed, Verstappen deploys DRS to clear Sainz and grab third. So, it's largely back to some degree of normality - for better or for worse...
2020-10-25T13:24:32Z: That early threat of rain appears to have eased, for now, with the pace picking up after those slippery first laps. That gives Leclerc enough encouragement to get past Raikkonen with the aid of DRS at Turn 1 to take sixth place off the Finn.
2020-10-25T13:23:33Z: Hamilton has cleared Sainz too, and it shouldn't be long for Verstappen to get past either as Sainz is struggling with tyre performance now.
2020-10-25T13:22:11Z: And Bottas re-passes Sainz to retake the lead! Sainz is now holding Hamilton, as Verstappen was rapid on the previous lap to join this battle.
2020-10-25T13:21:56Z: The race stewards have decided no investigation will be necessary for the clash between Perez and Verstappen. Not sure Racing Point will agree.
2020-10-25T13:20:44Z: Bottas has now got the tyres up to temperature, posting a 1m23.195 to close in on Sainz. Verstappen has now passed Norris too.
2020-10-25T13:20:03Z: Kvyat has also had a nightmare start to this race as drops to 19th place. In summary, those with grip in these early laps are flying and those without, well, are not.
2020-10-25T13:19:30Z: Another fastest lap for Sainz, who's keeping a DRS-sized gap to Bottas. Verstappen's now challenging Norris for fifth, with Raikkonen racing them both.
2020-10-25T13:18:10Z: Perez has managed to get going again in last place after his contact with Verstappen on the opening lap. That incident has been placed under investigation by the race stewards.
2020-10-25T13:17:55Z: Sainz posts a 1m23.466s to open a lead out to Bottas.
2020-10-25T13:17:33Z: Norris is up to fourth, who's trying to now go after Hamilton.
2020-10-25T13:17:05Z: The two Mercedes have just dropped off, and Sainz has roared past Hamilton and then Bottas!
2020-10-25T13:16:35Z: Sainz is in the lead! How on EARTH has this happened?!
2020-10-25T13:16:13Z: Further back it is a terrific start by Raikkonen who is already up to sixth place at the start of lap two. Cars are all over the place struggling for grip as the rain arrives right on time for this race!
2020-10-25T13:15:34Z: Hamilton gets a good start, but Bottas loses the place to Verstappen! Verstappen gets caught back up, Bottas pushing him aside, but the Dutchman tips Perez into a spin too!
2020-10-25T13:14:14Z: The 2020 Portuguese Grand Prix is goo!
2020-10-25T13:12:25Z: Anyway, the drivers get lined up on the grid, ready for the start...
2020-10-25T13:10:49Z: The formation lap is now underway!
2020-10-25T13:08:44Z: Tyre check: Verstappen, Perez, Albon, Sainz, Norris, Gasly, Ricciardo and Raikkonen softs. Magnussen hards, everyone else mediums.
2020-10-25T13:06:30Z: We're going to have 66 laps of this circuit, so it's going to be a challenging race for those struggling with grip around here.
2020-10-25T13:02:11Z: There's Chase Carey with his soon-to-be-replacement Stefano Domenicali on the grid, showing him the ropes of, well, conducting the world's fastest circus.
2020-10-25T13:00:17Z: Just 10 minutes to go, then, until we're underway in Portugal.
2020-10-25T12:57:47Z: As we've said many times this weekend, this is F1's first Portuguese Grand Prix since 1996. And, having watched some of those past races in anticipation, they were corkers.
2020-10-25T12:55:50Z: We have a risk of rain percentage: 40%. Which, judging by previous form, means the risk of rain is 0%.
2020-10-25T12:52:58Z: There's also been traffic issues of Paul Ricardian proportions. Our race team duo Smith and Kalinauckas struggled to carve through the congestion, but made it into the media centre with an hour to spare.
2020-10-25T12:51:02Z: Currently, it's a 6.7m/s tailwind down the main straight, which can play all sorts of havoc. But it could also play into the hands of the windier driver - Pi-air Gustly and Lance Squall should be in their element.
2020-10-25T12:46:56Z: Currently, the weather is relatively clement at Portimao. The air temp is around 21 degrees C, track at about 27 - but it's also very windy too.
2020-10-25T12:43:51Z: Hello everyone, today's the day! The Portuguese Grand Prix will begin in just over 25 minutes, and we'll be with you every step of the way.
